text: A lonely, rundown Victorian farmhouse surrounded by six-f high cornfields. A neglected barn in the distance. No neighbors in sight. Everything dark but for a flickering blue TV light from a upstairs window.

PAN ACROSS an array of framed photographs on a hallway wa stretching back generations - A recent color photo of a young man and woman on their we day. Sepia portraits of a homesteader family on the plain Kansas, everyone sturdy, solemn. Black & white portraits the '20's and '30s, lots of kids.

The woman in the color photo - TORI BREYER, early 30's, i sleeveless nightgown - studies herself in the mirror. She doesn't like what she sees. Too plain. Too Midwestern wholesome. So she tucks a lock of hair behind her ear. Unbuttons a couple buttons on her nightgown. She makes her way -

Her husband KYLE - 30's, thatchy beard, sturdy build - li bed scrolling around on his laptop. A TV plays a sitcom o Nick at Nite. Tori goes to Kyle. She gets on the bed, folds up his lapt sets them on a stack of books on the nightstand: Taking C of Your Fertility; The Everything Getting Pregnant Book; Miscarriage: Women Sharing From the Heart. Tori climbs on top of Kyle. Starts to kiss him. He's pleasantly surprised -
What's going on? Are you ovulating?
(between kisses) No. But for once let's not have it be work. Just fun.

Hell, it's always fun for me. He gets into it. They start messing around. Close. Intima tangle of hands and limbs. A bedside lamp flickers. The cable TV feed pixillates and stutters - jagged bursts of creepy sitcom laughter. Tori stops short.
Um... Ow.
(hyper-concerned) What, what? Her hair has become caught in his watchband. They both gi

Jesus, I'm sorry... He delicately maneuvers his wrist, unclips his watch, disentangles her hair. He throws his watch on the bed. She sits up, straddling his waist, her fingers interlaced his. He smiles. She smiles back at him. Then - A chain on the bedside lamp quivers, tinkling against the light fixture. Tori climbs off the bed. She's curious. Alert. As if the is suddenly charged. She ventures toward the hallway.
Babe? You okay? She looks down the dark hallway. Peering into the stillne She turns to Kyle.
I'm fine. For a second I thought -

You all right? She nods, shaken.
What was that?

I don't know, an earthquake? She gives him a withering glance. THAT was not an earthqu She notices something outside. She drifts toward the bedr window and looks out, disturbed. Kyle joins her. They see, far off, a FLICKERING LIGHT in the woods. A thi wisp of smoke rising into the night sky.

Headlights cut through a dirt road - deeper and deeper in woods thick with trees. Kyle at the wheel, Tori looking out the window. She wears red wool cardigan over her nightgown. Eerie old-time musi plays on a tinny dashboard radio. As they drive, the headlights cast ominous shadows. The surroundings become more atmospheric and foreboding. Kyle senses Tori's anxiety.

You know, we don't have to do this. Tori shrugs him off. She doesn't want to do this, but she has to. A SCREECH OF BIRDS flee from the forest. Kyle and Tori look up as an endless FLOCK OF CROWS surges overhead.  Kyle watches them pass: why are they all leaving? The song on the radio starts to garble and short out. Kyl fiddles with the radio knobs, the dashboard lights flicke

head_text.subj: A CROW HITS THE WINDSHIELD HEAD ON

text: Kyle LOSES CONTROL OF THE TRUCK. He wrestles with the whe the vehicle SKIDS OFF THE DIRT ROAD - AND NOSEDIVES INTO A SHALLOW DITCH, jolting Kyle and Tori The truck whinnies to a stop.

Goddamnit. Kyle and Tori climb out of the car. As he examines the da buckled hood, broken windshield - Tori stands cold and frightened. She can hear, faintly, far off - RASPY BREATHING - labore like a handsaw's back-and-forth.
Do you hear that? As he grabs a flashlight from the bed of the truck -
Hear what? He shines a flashlight on the jacked-up front hood. He's happy.
Oh, that's beautiful. My truck just got wrecked by a fucking crow. There's no response. He looks around and notices Tori wandering deeper into the woods - as if called.
Tori? She disappears into the brush.

What are you doing? He heads after her, raking his flashlight across the wood  He notices trees snapped, shorn off, the edges of their branches ON FIRE. Tiny embers wafting through the air. Th BREATHING getting louder. Kyle - disoriented - spots a glimpse of Tori's nightgown fluttering past some trees. He scrambles to catch up.

Tori... He sees her, briefly, just before she goes through some bushes, deeper into the woods. Kyle hurries to reach her. He shines the flashlight onto the ground and realizes he' a SMOLDERING TRENCH. A SHADOWY FIGURE APPROACHES behind him. He turns - shines flashlight - IT's TORI! Kyle is rattled. Tori is overcome with emotion. Almost beaming. She takes Kyle's hand, pulling at him, beckoning him deep into the forest. The RASPY BREATHING grows louder. A loom sense of dread. She leads him to a JUMBLE OF WRECKAGE SURROUNDED BY FLAME

head_text.subj: CRACKED POD MADE OF SOME KIND OF BLACK MINERAL, ITS SHELL

text: She reaches into the pod and takes out -
Kyle staggers back -
Jesus! What the fuck! Tori cradles the wheezing baby. He's no more than three pounds. Fragile in her hands. Helpless.
What is that?

It's a child. A boy.  6. Kyle frets as Tori holds the baby to her. The baby stares at Tori, needing her. Tori removes her cardigan and wraps around the child for warmth. Kyle stands back as Tori cradles the baby to her. The bab stares up at Tori, needing her. Tori removes her cardigan wraps it around the child for warmth.
Where'd it come from?
Does it matter?
We gotta call someone. The sheriff, child services, I don't know. Tori is lost in the newborn child. She strokes his scalp. breathing slows, steadies. Kyle steps toward Tori and the baby, mystified.
What should we do with him?
Take care of him. Kyle squirms, uncertain -—
Tori... Tori - welling with emotion - looks up at her husband.
We've been trying for a baby for so many years. All that pain, all that agony and heartache. The memory stabs at Kyle.
I know, I know...

All those nights we stayed up holding each other, wishing - praying - that God or the Universe or someone would help us. And now it's happened. He's here. A gift. Meant for us.  Blue (11/30/17) 7. Kyle is awed, caught up in something larger than himself. holds out his pinkie. The baby grasps it. Tori smiles. She kisses the baby's forehead. The family is together, complete, flames and smoldering s behind them. Tori and Kyle look down at the peaceful baby her arms.
A crisp autumn morning. Tori walks through sprawling farm She calls out -

Benjamin! Time for school! No reply. She lets out a two-tone SING-SONG WHISTLE. From some other part of the property she hears the same S SONG WHISTLE in reply. She smiles to herself. She walks across an expanse of patchy grass and heads tow an ABANDONED BARN. She playfully whistles again. From inside the barn, someone whistles back. Tori opens a dilapidated door. Barn swallows SCREECH - STARTLING HER - flying past her face. She watches the bir soar through sunlight filtering through old rotting windo and roof beams. She climbs up a ladder to an upper loft area, scanning th nooks and crevices - a game of hide and seek. She lets out a whistle. Elsewhere, closer now - the whist replies. She thinks she hears a creak from one of the floor boards She smiles, climbs down into a grain pit area - BENJAMIN leaps from some higher level and tackles Tori on moldering mess of hay.  Blue (11/30/17) 8. Tori winces, laughing -
You're getting too big for this game! Tori stares into Benjamin's eyes. He's gangly, 11 going o hair uncombed, his eyes alert.
But you'll always be my baby boy. Benjamin smiles. He rises and lifts Tori to her feet -
Took you long enough to find me. Kyle - wearing jeans, work gloves in his hand, fresh from fields - enters the barn. He's got a noticeable limp.
What are you guys doing in here?
I was just hiding and stuff.
C'mon, you know the barn is off limits. Kyle double-checks the padlock on a hinged trap door buil into the floor of the grain pit area.
All these loose boards and nails and shit, I just don't want you to break your neck.
He knows that. We were about to leave. Kyle puts his arm around his son -

Sorry if I gotta be the big bad Dad now and again... Benjamin rolls his eyes. The family heads out of the barn the vast farmland and the morning light. PUSH IN on the trap door in the barn, giving off a FAINT, THROBBING HUM. INSISTENT. FOREBODING.  Blue (11/30/17) 9.
A SCIENCE TEACHER stands next to a video projection - ima of bees and wasp dance off of her in the darkened room.

Wasps and bees. Both members of the same insect family, both with two pairs of wings, both with stingers. As the teacher lectures, a pretty girl with frizzy hair - CAITLYN - peers over at Benjamin making childlike doodles his notebook - variations on his name and initials. SCIENCE TEACHER (CONT’D) Can anyone tell me any differences between them? Mr. Breyer? Benjamin looks up at her.
Well, um... bees are pollinators, wasps are predators.
Good, good.

Wasps are more aggressive. More dangerous. One species, Polistes sulcifer, is what's called a brood parasite. A blue-eyed boy, ROYCE, exchanges glances with a kid with FAUXHAWK, the two of them stifling a snicker. BENJAMIN (CONT’D) These wasps have lost the ability to build their own nests, so they use brute force to get other wasp species to raise their young. They make them feed their babies beetle larvae and maggots. An awkward silence from the class. Royce pipes up -
Yo man, how'd they taste? The classroom ERUPTS in laughter. Benjamin is bruised. As the teacher tries to quiet the class, Caitlyn leans ov Benjamin and whispers -  10.
Don't worry about that idiot. Some day he'll be working for you. Benjamin takes this in. Caitlyn returns to her notebook. smiles to himself.

Tori washes dishes in the sink, steam rising. The kitchen off dining and living rooms that haven't changed in gener - peeling wallpaper, heavy dark furniture, old porcelain A LOUD THUMP from upstairs. Tori turns off the sink. Listens. She calls upstairs -

Ben? A grandfather clock TICK-TOCKS. Then, from somewhere in the house, she hears - A LOW MURMURING NOISE. GHASTLY. SINISTER. Tori is creeped. She makes her way toward a back STUDY off the living room Kyle is slumped on an old couch, sleeping, the TV playing old movie with the sound off. Tori whispers -

Kyle, do you hear that? He mumbles incoherently. She returns to the living room. She hears a SMALL CLATTER outside - trash cans maybe. Then a PAINED GUTTURAL MOAN. She opens the back screen door and goes -  Blue (11/30/17) 11.

A jagged breeze. Wind chimes trill. Tori stands on a wraparound porch. She scans the backyard area. Bare light bulb behind her. fields a blanket of darkness. She zeroes in on a rusty swing CREAKING BACK AND FORTH. Is that what she heard? Then, across the yard, SOMEONE WALKS THROUGH HER PERIPHER VISION. Tori jolts as she watches BENJAMIN BEE-LINE INTO THE BACK OBLIVIOUS TO TORI, OBLIVIOUS TO EVERYTHING, in a kind of zombie trance. It's chilling. Unsettling.
Benjamin? He keeps walking through fluttering sheets on the clothes Through the backyard. Past the coop - chickens SQUAWKING WILDLY.

Benjamin! Tori follows Benjamin as he staggers toward the barn - a figure in his pajamas receding into the vast darkness. Tori can make out an eerie RINGING NOISE - keening, pulsa emanating from inside the barn. Faintly at first, then growing. Tori heads toward the source of the noise. She enters -

Almost pitch black. Scary as hell. Tori trying to find Benjamin in the shadows. The ringing noise beckoning him. She FINDS HIM IN THE GRAIN PIT AREA, THE TRAP DOOR IN THE FLOOR OPEN, PEERING INSIDE. Down in the pit is the BLACK POD HE ARRIVED IN AS A BABY. shell is putrefying. Crawling with carrion beetles. It THROBS, KEENING.  Blue (11/30/17) 12. Benjamin stands over it - MURMURING IN SOME HUSHED ALIEN GIBBERISH -— He reaches out to the pod. He MAKES CONTACT WITH IT, the keening growing LOUDER.
Benjamin. Benjamin turns - startled - his hand grazing the metallic of the pod. The keening noise STOPS. Benjamin clutches his hand in pain. He's disoriented. Wea Lost.
What happened? Tori supports Benjamin. She examines his injured hand. A TRICKLE OF BLOOD runs from his finger.
It cut me.
I know. I'm sorry, baby. Tori uses her shirt to squeeze Benjamin's fingers, stanch the bleeding, her shirt now blotted with blood.
(in a daze) I heard... I don't know what it was. Voices or something. Tori looks into his eyes, searching, trying to figure out much to tell him.
You were dreaming. She soothes Benjamin's hair.

Let's forget this happened, okay? Tori holds Benjamin, comforting him, trying to be strong, deep down she's frightened, a sense of something new and terrifying welling up inside of her.  Blue (11/30/17) 13.

The room is dark and shadowy, cluttered with the detritus different eras: a radiator from the 1910's, cowboy wallpa from the '40s. Tori lovingly tucks Benjamin into bed. She makes sure he's asleep. Kisses his forehead. She heads out of his room, closing the CREAKING DOOR slow careful not to make too much noise. She turns, and -—
She jumps, startled.
Everything okay? She fidgets.
I don't know. He was... sleepwalking I guess.
(suspicious) Where? Tori catches herself, decides to protect Kyle -
Downstairs. He's fine. C'mon, you got an early morning.
First-person video POV of stock cars racing around a trac crashing into each other. Benjamin and Tori sit side-by-side at the wheels of a NAS Racing arcade game. Tori is having a blast.
Three members of a wait staff CLAP IN TIME WHILE CHANTING BIRTHDAY TUNE. We're in a casual dining place. The waiter down a sundae with a lit candle in front of Benjamin -  14.

Happy happy birthday! We whipped up something cold! Benjamin is moody, distant. He's surrounded by Kyle, Tori AUNT MERILEE - 30's, sunny - and his UNCLE NOAH - late 30 pudgy, affable. Benjamin contorts his face, turned off by the cheery song WAIT STAFF (CONT’D) Happy happy birthday! For someone getting old! Tori snaps a photo with her phone as Benjamin blows out t candle. The staff whoops it up, wishes him happy birthday then heads off.
Wow. I think they use that to break prisoners at Guantanamo. Benjamin half-smiles.
Sorry, I did not know they were gonna do that. Noah puts his arm around Benjamin.
Was it punishment for something? Bad grades?
(proudly) You've heard about his test scores, right? Top one percent.
Top one-tenth of one percent. Everyone on the faculty has been talking about him.
And he's just getting started. She starts to get choked up.
So much ahead of you.  15.
Well, a boy that special deserves a special gift. This is from me and your Aunt Merilee. He hands Benjamin a long wrapped gift. Merilee
Go ‘head. Benjamin tears off the wrapping to reveal a REMINGTON BOL ACTION RIFLE.
Shot my first buck with that very same model.
No. No way. Tori, we discussed this.
I know, but -
(to Benjamin) You're not ready. Kyle takes the rifle from him. Benjamin flares with anger
I'm twelve years old.
Exactly. You're still a child. Benjamin is irate. He stares down Kyle. Arcade games malfunction in the b.g.
Give that to me. It's mine.
(taken aback) What'd you say to me?
I_said - give it to me. Tori and Kyle are stunned. They've never seen this behavi from Benjamin before. Benjamin glares at his Dad -  Blue (11/30/17) 16.
(furious) Okay. You're done. No ice cream. Kyle knocks the sundae aside - the glass bowl clattering across the table. Other customers steal glances at them.
We're leaving. Kyle stands to go, grabbing Benjamin by the elbow - Benjamin doesn't budge. An immovable force. Kyle is about to lose it -
Get _up. Benjamin boils. It's a standoff. Tori tenderly touches Benjamin's arm.
Benjamin... Listen to your father. Benjamin looks at his mom. A moment passes between them. Benjamin gives in. He rises to go.
(to Merilee and Noah) I'm so sorry, guys. Merilee and Noah beg off: not our business. Tori and Kyle leave with Benjamin.
Tori sits on a couch, removes her shoes, rubs her feet. K gets a longneck from the fridge, pops the cap.
Turns twelve years old, suddenly gets a mouth on him.

It was so strange. So unlike him.  Blue (11/30/17) 17. Kyle limps toward the living room, thinks he notices some outside - glances out a window behind Tori. He sees wind blowing through the trees, spindly shadows on the yard -
Maybe just the wind.
I worry about him. Getting older. Changing. Maybe it's all normal, I don't know. Kyle sits next to Tori. Takes a swig from his beer.
Oh, we were so much worse when we were his age. The shit we got into? Sneaking out on school nights, smoking weed in my parents' basement... Kyle twinkles at the memory -

Fucking around on that puke-green couch down there. Every time the floor would creak upstairs I'd zip my damn pants up... They laugh as he nuzzles up to her, puts his hand on her thigh. She returns his affection.
We were such idiots. But we pulled through, didn't we?
Barely. Your parents were okay I guess. Mine sucked. She laughs.
I just want us to be better than that. Kyle ruminates. The large window above them, trees waveri outside, scraping the glass.
How 'bout we all go camping up in Drywood this weekend? The three of us.  Blue (11/30/17) 18.
Oo - we haven't done that in forever. She happily climbs on top of him.
Know what else we haven't done in forever? She smiles as they start kissing.

A RICKETY AUTOMATIC DOOR OPENS on a garage packed with bo gardening tools, a 1970's sedan, its hood stacked with pa cans. Kyle carries the the Remington rifle from his truck into garage. The wind chimes jangle. He climbs on a work bench He reaches above a cabinet, moves aside Christmas lights mason jars filled with nails. Goes to PLACE THE RIFLE on of the cabinet - The light bulb in the garage flickers and dims. Kyle stops. He hears, from outside, A LOW MURMURING NOISE GHASTLY. SINISTER. The same noise Tori heard from Benjami He listens. He can make out the FLUTTER AND SQUAWK of chickens - Rising into a CACOPHONY OF PANICKED SCREECHES, FLESH TEAR punctuated by a PAINED GUTTURAL MOAN. Then - silence. Nothing but the wind chimes. Kyle climbs down from the work bench with the rifle. He grabs two bullets from a box on a shelf, opens the cha of the rifle, presses them in. He slides the bolt shut wi CLICK. He ventures out into the yard, toward the chicken coop, r leading the way into the darkness.  Blue (11/30/17) 19. He treads lightly, past the squeaking swing set, planning sneak up on whatever got to the chickens. He hears a dripping near a tall tree. He limps toward it. stops to listen. DROPS OF BLOOD fall onto his face. He wipes at his face, his hand slick with blood. What the hell? He looks up - There's a MANGLED CHICKEN CARCASS lodged in the branches. He walks further and discovers - A few more CHICKEN CARCASSES scattered throughout the property, torn open, entrails smeared along the ground. Then - A RUSTLING FROM THE CORNFIELD. Kyle spins. SOMETHING'S IN THERE. WHISPERING STRANGE NOISES - a kind of ALIEN GIBBERISH. Kyle steadies his rifle. He HEADS INTO THE DARK CORNFIELD. He uses the barrel of the rifle to nudge aside leafy corn stalks. His heart is pounding. His breath shallow. His footsteps CRUNCHING dry leaves. He can see SPLATTERS OF BLOOD on the leaves of corn. He goes deeper into the cornfield. Now almost engulfed by stalks. He can barely see a foot in front of him. He comes out on an empty space between the rows of corn. All is silent. He listens for the intruder. Then -

head_text.subj: SOMETHING BLEATS AT KYLE FROM HIS SIDE

text: Kyle SPINS WITH THE RIFLE -  Blue (11/30/17) 20. He relaxes. It's a HORRIBLY WOUNDED CHICKEN, one wing rip off, a chunk of flesh missing, squawking in agony, stumbl in circles. Kyle aims the rifle point blank at the thing and FIRES, putting it out of its misery. The shot echoes miles away. Kyle stands in the cornfield with his rifle. He calls out the darkness -—
Fuck you, wolf! I outrank you on the food chain! You come round again, I'll kill your ass! No reply. Kyle is alone amid a vast sea of corn stalks.

Benjamin heads toward the truck, where Kyle packs camping supplies. He wears a t-shirt, a backpack over his shoulde He seems more inward, more distant, than he did earlier. Tori calls out from a wraparound porch -
Benjamin, where's your jacket?
I don't need one.
It's 40 degrees! Benjamin slumps his shoulders and sulks.
Fine, I'll get it. She goes -
Through the kitchen and living room. She hastens upstairs. Into -  Blue (11/30/17) 21.

Tori sifts through the clutter, looking for Benjamin's ja She spots it thrown by his bed. She crouches down and not between the mattress and box spring a SHEAF OF CRINKLED PAPERS. She takes them out and pages through them. From downstairs, Kyle calls -
Hon? You about ready? Tori is lost in the pages. Concerned. Kyle joins her in the room.
You find it?
I found... something. She hands him the pages. On top is a Target ad featuring models in bikinis. Kyle is amused -
Is this his idea of porn? He sees a Memorial Day Sale mailer with women in bras. He amused -

Mailers from Target - for the truly hardcore. He leafs through and finds PAGES FROM AN ANATOMY TEXTBOOK Medical diagrams of the FEMALE REPRODUCTIVE SYSTEM. An illustration of a NAKED FEMALE and her endocrine system. SECTIONS OF THE VAGINA, THE CERVIX, THE UTERUS.

head_text.subj: PINK TISSUE. TANGLES OF RED AND BLUE VEINS. TECHNICAL. RA

text: What the hell?
Is it just a guy thing?
Not any guy I know. Not this.  Blue (11/30/17) 22.
Maybe it's time you had a talk with him. You know, birds, bees, et cetera. Kyle sighs. He doesn't want to.
Fine. I'll give him the same talk my dad gave me: ‘It's the second hole from the back of the neck.'
Ugh. She swats at him.

A crisp afternoon, sun dead over the horizon. A cheap dom tent set up at a campsite. Tori takes a couple of gnarled steaks from a package and salts them. Up the hillside, Kyle and Benjamin crinkle through brown leaves, gathering firewood. Kyle tries to be casual -
So, uh, Ben... I know you just had your birthday.
Yeah.
Which means you're a young man, your body's starting to change.
Okay.
So you might find yourself more and more interested in women. And women's bodies. Benjamin looks up at Kyle - cold, upset -
Were you in my room?  Blue (11/30/17) 23.
What? No.
I don't like it when people go through my private stuff.
Look, I respect that. I was the same way at your age - I thought about girls all the time, and no one ever told me it was okay to touch it or play with it.
With what?
You know. The, uh - my penis.
Okay.
But here's the thing: sex isn't about organs and body parts. I mean, it is. But it's really about finding the right person, falling in love.
And making babies.
Eventually. Even then, that's not the only purpose of sex. Your mother and I, we still - you know, partake. And she can't have babies. Benjamin is taken aback.
What do you mean?
That's why we went to an adoption agency.
Mom can't have children? Like no matter what? Benjamin chews his fingernails, simmering. He looks at To seeming betrayed. Kyle is baffled.  Blue (11/30/17) 24.
What's this about? Were you wanting a baby brother or sister? Because we're happy with you. With the three of us.
That's not it. Kyle gets close to Benjamin, tries to connect with him -

Look, maybe my words came out stupid. Just know that you're a guy, and you're gonna be feeling certain urges about girls you see in movies, girls in your class, whatever. It's okay to give into them now and again. Benjamin looks up at Kyle. He nods, placated.
Benjamin's classmate Caitlyn lies on her comforter in paj bottoms and a t-shirt, talking on her phone, her frizzy h dangling over the foot of the bed.

Okay... Jesus, I'm at, like, zero percent, so I should probably go. Caitlyn rises and crosses toward her desk. She passes her second-story window and doesn't see - outside - A BLURRY FIGURE IN HER YARD, WATCHING HER. CAITLYN (CONT’D) (on her phone, laughing) Same to you, dork. Mwah. She hangs up her phone and sets it on her desk. She plugs into her charger. Her home screen blinks weirdly and goes dead. Probably out of battery. Caitlyn turns off her ligh She passes her window again. This time the figure is CLOS SOMEHOW RIGHT OUTSIDE HER WINDOW - HOVERING. Caitlyn plops into her bed, throws covers over herself. We see, behind Caitlyn - HER WINDOW IS OPEN. The LONG CUR FLUTTERING LIGHTLY. Caitlyn nestles into her pillow. She closes her eyes.  25. Everything calm and quiet. Then she hears - EERIE MUSIC PLAYING. Something spooky and romantic, like Mazzy Star. Caitlyn is terrified. She lifts her head and sees - Her laptop is OPEN, GLOWING. The song playing on iTunes. She gets out of bed. She approaches her computer, confused. No one in sight. S shuts the laptop. The music stops. She turns around to head to bed. THE MUSIC PLAYS AGAIN BEHIND HER. Caitlyn sees her laptop open again. Her heart rate quicke She's almost shaking with fear. She slams the laptop shut. She stacks heavy books on the Her room now silent. She notices the accordion doors on her closet SLIGHTLY AJ She slowly advances toward it. She reaches out to the knob of the door... She grasps it and - SLOWLY SLIDES THE ACCORDION DOORS. They SQUEAK open. The closet is pitch black. Caitlyn reaches up, pulls a chain, and turns on a bare li bulb. Just clothes on hangars. Shoe boxes. Piles of old toys an board games. Caitlyn steels herself and - QUICKLY PARTS THE CLOTHES ON HANGARS — Just a plain wall behind the clothes. She parts more hangars. Then a couple more.  Blue (11/30/17) 26. Then parts another -

She jumps back! It's just an old RAG DOLL with a torn-up face. Caitlyn lowers her guard. She turns off the closet light. Closes the door, turns, a - walks, oblivious, DIRECTLY PAST BENJAMIN STANDING BEHIN LONG FLUTTERING CURTAINS.

The hair on her neck raises. She senses something awful a terrifying - She sees BENJAMIN STARING AT HER, CURTAINS SWIRLING AROUN IN THE NIGHT AIR. CAITLYN LETS OUT A BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAM. She TURNS TO RUN OUT OF HER ROOM. The door SWINGS OPEN -

head_text.subj: A DARK SILHOUETTE STANDS IN THE DOORWAY

text: It's her mom, ERICA. Caitlyn is crying.
What's wrong? What's wrong?

Someone's there! By the curtains! Erica flips on the LIGHTS. She approaches the windows - Slowly. Cautiously. She grasps the curtains - AND OPENS THEM. There's no one there. The window is closed. Nothing amiss Caitlyn is a wreck.
Honey, no one's here.  Blue (11/30/17) 27.
He was right there. I think it was... this kid from my class. Erica is dubious.
Were you watching scary movies on your phone again?
I wasn't, I swear. But even Caitlyn is starting to doubt herself. CAITLYN (CONT’D) Can I sleep in your bed tonight?
Of course. Of course.

Tori STARTLES AWAKE. She's in a sleeping bag next to Kyle in their tent. She f at an empty sleeping bag - Benjamin is gone. The tent door is unzipped, flaps blowing in the breeze. J crickets and katydids outside.
Benjamin? Kyle wakes -
What's wrong?
Benjamin - he's gone. The two of them scramble out of the tent. Kyle calls out
Ben! In a panic she grabs a flashlight. Kyle starts to split f Tori -

You check that way, I'll take over here.  Blue (11/30/17) 28. Tori nods nervously and goes into the forest. She shines the flashlight everywhere. Acres of trees rece into total darkness. She's alone. She hears a FLUTTER somewhere in the trees, crow SQUAWKING. She looks behind her. No sign of Kyle. The embers of the campfire receding into the night. She's scared.

Benjamin, can you hear me?... Where are you, baby? Tori hears RUSTLING IN THE TREES ABOVE. Seeds and acorns dropping around her. She shines the flashlight up into the tall trees - vertig dizzying, casting eerie shadows. She thinks she sees SOME MOVING UP THERE.

Benjamin? Her flashlight starts to flicker and spasm. Tori rattles it, trying to jar the batteries back into pl The light goes back on. She shines it up. Nothing up ther She lowers the flashlight - BENJAMIN IS DIRECTLY BEHIND HER. Tori startles - then loosens.
